reviews.sentence: Elegance and Fun. We live in Houston but went here for a staycation. We upgraded to a corner room which was spacious and really nice with a great view of the pool Ideally located that we Ubered to Del Friscos for dinner and stayed at the hotel because of their fun bar with dance floor. The hotel has a great atmosphere and fun clientele. The dance floor starts filling up as wedding guests start spilling in from local weddings they attended and are staying at this hotel. The rooms are really quiet and nice. We will be staying here more often as a fun staycation on the weekends.

do not stay here. I pre checked in 2 days prior to my stay and when I arrived at Omni after 3PM the room was not ready and I was told it would be 45 minutes until it would be ready. Lo and behold two of my other friends checked in after I did and received Deluxe King rooms without doing express check in. I had to get ready for a wedding so I was incredibly disappointed that I was not offered another room an upgrade something. I had give this 1 star. In Noe it took 15 minutes for a server to greet me and get my drink order. This bar is not that big and it was not that busy. It took another 25 minutes for the food to come out but the server was friendly and brought me the check right away when I asked. I had give this 2 stars. The valet parking. I do not even know where to begin. TERRIBLE. Omni charges for self parking 20. so I figured I had spend an extra 10 to do valet. Both times I called valet to pull my car around BEFORE I left my hotel room I waited for THIRTY minutes before the car arrived. Unbelievable. The parking garage is literally right across the street. I had give this 0 stars. We also ordered room service breakfast. They forgot the coffee and tea so all we received was toast and apple juice and hot water. Really. I give this 1 star. Overall my experience at Omni Houston Riverway was beyond terrible. From check in to the bar to valet I have never experienced so much incompetence from staff members as a collective whole. I am never one to complain and I always have a lot of patience especially when hotels are busy but the service I received throughout my entire stay was unacceptable. I honestly should have asked for a refund but even that would not make up for all the things that went wrong during this stay. I will not be staying here again and I urge anyone who thinks they want to think again. Save yourself the headache.

Christmas Eve In Houston. Upscale luxury hotel in Galleria area of Houston. Great views spotless rooms friendly helpful staff restaurant was excellent and Spa is recommended. Christmas Eve is my Birthday so criteria for booking this Hotel was Spa Restaurant and Bar. The first two were wonderful. I was told by staff bar would be open until midnight. When going into dining room at 8 pm I asked at the bar again and yes they would be open. Finished dinner at 945 only to be informed bar was closing. This is not unusual on Christmas Eve I understand however I was given misinformation and not pleased about that given criteria for booking this hotel. Please Management understand staff needs to be informed or verify when giving information as I made it very clear this would be an important part of this celebration. Disapointed to say the least as I traveled from AZ.

Great Houston Hotel for location. We often book this Omni for its wonderful location near the Galleria area and some of our favorite restaurants. It is a great place for a Staycation. We had a meeting scheduled for the next morning in one of the ballrooms and it was a delightful place to stay in preparing for the meeting. Gracious staff pleasant surroundings and again terrific location. I love Omni hotels for their Omni Select guest plan. Nothing beats the complimentary carafe of coffee and paper delivery to my room as well as the complimentary Wi Fi.

Nice downtown getaway. I chose this hotel for its pool. Although we were hampered by thunderstorms we did get a chance to swim at night. The large pool is actually 2 separate pools with one being warmed to 82F year round. The Noe restaurant breakfast buffet was outstanding and so was their service. All hotel staff were extremely kind. My only negative comment would be the one road in out of the hotel. While we did not have issues personally there was a prom for a large high school going on while we were there. It seemed that there was quite a long line of cars trying to get into the prom and I imagine many waited for a long time to get in. We were otherwise not impacted by the prom being held there. The facilities are plenty large enough to handle such a shindig and not impact their guests. Thank you for a great stay Omni Riverway.

Great Experience. Good experience very nice comfortable room staff well trained and helpful lobby very comfortable. Location central to excellent shopping and dining and centrally located for activities in different areas of Houston. No issues with stay at all.
Best Thanksgiving buffet.

We have visited here at least 3 times in the last year and have had a great experience each time. The staff is amazing from the valet concierge housekeeping servers at breakfast everyone is pleasant and always smiling. I brought my pet on our last stay thinking the staff may frown upon it but they were great. Loved the top floor view. The grounds are well kept and rooms very clean I miss the complementary mouthwash though. We visit Houston every other month with plans to move here and will definitely stay here each time.

Great family wedding celebration. This hotel is a very upscale beautiful hotel. We had a wonderful time with family and friends. It was the family event of the year. The room was terrific and the bed was very comfortable. I loved the breakfast buffets and found the wait staff to be very attentive.

Excellent Stay. My husband and I stayed at the Omni Houston Hotel Riverway for two nights in early December 2018 for a short getaway. With the rewards program Black status we were upgraded to a suite with pool view. The hotel is newly renovated and just reopened so everything is pristine and modern. The room was very spacious and nicely decorated. Housekeeping was perfect and timely. We enjoyed the in room coffee service we had each morning and also the breakfast room service eggs etc. one day. The Whiskey Bar was fun to visit one evening and drinks were good. The restaurant Birdies was very pleasant and the food tasty but the portions were at times small and the overall menu prices were expensive for some of the ingredients and portion sizes. We ate all our meals there and the staff were nice. The pool was beautiful and we were lucky to be there on a weekend with great weather in December 75 degrees and sunny. We did not use the gym but when passing by it seemed spacious with many treadmills and other general equipment. Also the conference reception space seemed to be nice and accommodate large parties for holiday events or weddings. Overall the entire hotel staff from front desk housekeeping dining bar and more were friendly and professional. We live in Houston and we would definitely stay here again during any time of the year for a weekend get a way.

Omni recently went through a 30 million renovation. The hotel looks spectacular. They have a nice luxury boutique spa club and lounge private dining pool and more. It ’s the perfect place for a staycation or a special event. The chef there makes some delicious dishes. It ’s close to the Galleria but away from all the heavy traffic.

Omni nice stay as expected. Very nice place like most Omni hotels. The location was very good parking was not an issue. The breakfast buffet was lacking compared to some other Omni hotels I usually stay at but that is just really a minor complaint.

Great Staff. Over priced for amenitys. The only thing saving this place was the staff. The place seems a bit dated. No breakfast no parking vouchers. All things most places include at this price point. No chain hotel points. It was clean. But I would not make it a point to go there again. It feels like its in a back alley.
Beautiful interior. Multiple bars one being a whiskey bar. Rooms are great as well.

Hotel gets just an OK from me nothing really wrong just acaerage but I have high standards and would need to do more to please me. Breakfast service needs up its game very slow. Would I stay again probably not as time to try somewhere else.

Nice hotel. Room was not to my satisfaction as one of the main lights did n’t work and the coffee had no creamer available so had to go to restaurant for a cup of coffee. Also did n’t like the fact the bar closed at 10 on both Saturday and Sunday nights. Since that ’s important to me I will stay somewhere else on my next visit to Houston.

Some good some not so much. The Omni always has an amazing ambiance and beautiful decor. Guest room is always comfortable and quiet. Overall service from the employees is courteous and helpful. But I was disappointed in the lack of spa amenities. The spa treatments were amazing but the extras were lacking. For example there was no jacuzi. It was simply a tiny plunge pool for two people. Also there was no fine dining for dinner.

A disappointment compared to other Omnis. I was very dissatisfied with this stay compared to other Omni Hotel stays I have had in other cities. There was no refrigerator in the room so forget saving leftovers from restaurants there was no vending machines that we could find to get a drink either on our floor or in the lobby and the hotel store always seemed to be closed or out of what we needed the ice machine on our floor was in some kind of janitors closet with wires from some kind of electrical box sticking out behind it and it was an old school ice machine that had a scoper on a chain instead of just pushing a button like newer ice machines. There is literally nothing around this hotel within walking distance except commercial offices and condos so you have to rely on the hotel shuttle to go eat anywhere but that can lead to extremely long wait times for drop off and pick up if you are there during a conference like I was. The one restaurant this hotel has I thought was terrible with extremely slow service even though I ate there at an off hour time so the restaurant was not busy not a lot of food choices and extremely overpriced. For example I paid 15 for mac n cheese. We were kicked out of the pool on multiple nights BEFORE the advertised closing time posted on the sign and we were NOT being loud in any way. We went to the pool until we were kicked out because there was absolutely nothing else to do or no where to go after the hotel shuttle stopped for the night. I would not stay here again if I had the choice next time this conference comes to Houston. C at best.

What a joke. This place ca n’t get it together. We were here for a conference and they kept charging our cards over and over. They charged my card after I told them that the morning shift had already run it. They proceed to tell me that it was n’t saved so they run it again. I wake up to find two separate charges on my account so they proceed to fix it that next morning. I come back from dinner only to find out that I ’m locked out of my room so I have to go get a new card. Again they are clueless. Well not “ they ” but “ David ” who also proceeded to tell my co worker he did n’t know what to do after he messed up by getting her a 60 charge on her debit for running her card twice as well. Disgusted. The only positive thing I can say was that the morning staff were so professional about getting our stuff fixed after the afternoon shift messed it up. SMH.

First of all the staff at the front desk and the shuttle driver were fantastic and accommodating. They assisted me with many things during our short stay. I was however disappointed with the size of the room service menu and that my son was not given the activity backpack or the cookies and milk service at night. The biggest disappointment though was that our tv did n’t work the entire time even though they told me someone was working on the hotel wide outage. I asked for the parking to be comped and the manager approved it but then I was told I could n’t get a receipt at checkout which I thought was strange.
